definition: to burgeon/to produce/to conceive/to be in the initial stage
to sprout/to bud/to have a strong affection for (slang)/adorable (loanword from Japanese 萌え moe, slang describing affection for a cute character)
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: At this moment, an idea came into Tucheng ' s mind, which was to make artificial cultivated land.
sentences.chinese: 此时的土成有一个心愿，他萌生了人造耕地的想法。

sentences.english: Liberty, when it begins to take root, is a plant of rapid growth.
sentences.chinese: 自由一旦生根便是朱迅萌生长的植物。

sentences.english: The path of crack initiation and growth is transgranular under conditions of isothermal low cycle fatigue.
sentences.chinese: 在等温低周疲劳载荷下，裂纹主要为穿晶萌生与扩展。

sentences.english: This essay investigates the emergence of society from the perspective of social system Luhmanns.
sentences.chinese: 本文试图从鲁曼的系统理论来探讨社会体的萌生特质。

sentences.english: Yet for advocates of fuel-cell cars, hope springs eternal.
sentences.chinese: 而对燃料电池汽车的支持者来说，希望永远都在萌生。

sentences.english: Sochaux have approached Liverpool for want-away striker Anthony Le Tallec.
sentences.chinese: 索肖因萌生去意的利物浦前锋勒塔莱接触利物浦。

sentences.english: Vegetative shoots of Calocedrus formosana continually initiated leaves and lateral branches from early March until the end of October.
sentences.chinese: 台湾肖楠每年从三月至十月底萌生新叶与侧枝。

sentences.english: The Quercus forest in the Northwest of Yunnan Province showed a strong sprouting ability.
sentences.chinese: 滇西北的川滇高山栎具有很强的萌生能力。

sentences.english: They have just initiation love was young has gone through the test of life and death.
sentences.chinese: 他们刚刚萌生的爱情幼苗也历经生死的考验。

sentences.english: The results showed that all the cracks were initiated from the notch.
sentences.chinese: 分析两次试验结果发现，裂纹都在缺口处萌生。

sentences.english: There is a military character in Qin s culture which is born in multifarious wars.
sentences.chinese: 萌生于频繁征战的秦文化先天具有军事性。

sentences.english: Fracture is mainly intergranular and transgranular under conditions of triangular wave shape.
sentences.chinese: 在同相位梯形波载荷下，裂纹主要为沿晶萌生与扩展。

sentences.english: Since the initiation Yu from the sea of bright sense of disloyalty .
sentences.chinese: 自瑜萌生起对海亮不忠的感觉。

sentences.english: Looking through his composition , a new opinion came into his mind.
sentences.chinese: 浏览着作文时，一个新观点在他的头脑中萌生了。

sentences.english: After graduation, she had an idea.
sentences.chinese: 毕业后，她萌生了一个想法。

sentences.english: The threshold of the fatigue crack initiation from the notch of the microbeam is close to that of the bulk material.
sentences.chinese: 疲劳裂纹从尖缺口处萌生的门槛值接近块体材料。

definition: way of thinking/opinion/notion/to think of a way (to do sth)/CL:個|个[ge4]
to give birth/to grow (whiskers etc)/to generate/to produce
lit. to be together from the first beat (idiom)/to hit it off/to click together/to chime in easily
to have an urge/to be impetuous/impulse/urge
arising involuntarily (idiom); spontaneous/to spring up unbidden (of emotion)
to think/to believe/to suppose/to wish/to want/to miss (feel wistful about the absence of sb or sth)
to sprout (lit. or fig.)/to bud/to germinate/germ/seed/bud
once it gets started there's no stopping it
pinyin: yi1 fa1 bu4 ke3 shou1 shi5

definition: to begin to stir (idiom)/to get restless/to become threatening
